page.title: 03Church of St.Mary the Virgin
page.content: It was first built in 1179 and the rector was Andrew.The church was rebuilt in 1396 and at that stage Thomous Patesly was the vicar.In 1798 the church tower fell and when being rebuilt it was shortened by one bay. Christopher Herbert was made vicar in 1978 and still is today.The church has seven services a week and four of these are on Sundays.The average congregation is 48.There are five bells which are still rung.There are nine stained glass windows each with an inscription at the bottom. After recent excavations only few fragments were found of the old church.
